ExpressRoute

Dedicated private network fiber connections to Azure

Apply for 1RMB Trial Buy Now

ExpressRoute is a service that enables you to create private connections between Azure datacenters and customer-owned environment. ExpressRoute connections don't go over the public internet, and offer more reliability, faster speeds, and lower latencies than internet connections.

ExpressRoute Premium Edition Add-on

ExpressRoute Premium is an add-on over the ExpressRoute Unlimited Data Plan/Metered Data Plan charges. The ExpressRoute Premium add-on provides the following capabilities:

  • Increased routing table limit from 4,000 routes to 10,000 routes for public and private peering.
  • Connect any China regions through the Azure Core Network. An ExpressRoute circuit created in any China region will have access to resources across any other region. For example, a VNet created in China East can be accessed through an ExpressRoute circuit created in China North.
  • Increased number of VNets that can be enabled on an ExpressRoute circuit from 10 to a larger limit (the exact number depends on the bandwidth of the circuit).

For more details, please refer to the ExpressRoute Service Documentation page.

FAQ

Expand All
  • Which datacenters are available for an ExpressRoute physical dedicated line in China?

    ExpressRoute physical dedicate line connections are available in China East, China East 2, China North and China North 2.

  • What additional charges will I incur from other parties in this solution?

    The ExpressRoute connection service provider will charge you extra fees. Please contact your network connection service provider for pricing information.

  • How many ports are included in the monthly fee for ExpressRoute?

    For the purpose of redundancy, 2 ports are included in the monthly fee as shown (on 2 routers).

  • If I connect to one of China's ExpressRoute locations (such as Eastern China), can I access other regions in China via ExpressRoute?

    Yes. You can purchase ExpressRoute Unlimited Data Plan/Metered Data Plan to connect from China East to China East 2. You will have access to resources across any other region in China via ExpressRoute Premium Add-on.

  • Can I connect to any Azure region from a given ExpressRoute location?

    No. ExpressRoute in China can only be connected to regions within China. You cannot access Azure services in other countries through ExpressRoute in China.

  • Can I set up multiple circuits in my account? If so, what do I need to do?

    Yes. If you are using Azure based on an Enterprise Agreement with 21Vianet, please contact our data setup team to ensure correct setup.

  • If I use ExpressRoute for a portion of the month, will the fees be different?

    If your ExpressRoute service is valid for the entire month, you will be charged at the monthly rate, regardless of how you use it. However, if you cancel the ExpressRoute service during the month, you will only be charged for the port charges for the hours of service you used, as well as the cost of the data transfer that occurred during the month in which the service was cancelled.

  • When does the billing for ExpressRoute start and stop?

    ExpressRoute billing starts when a service key is issued to the customer, and it stops after a customer deletes a circuit (please contact the ExpressRoute connection provider to de-provisioned the circuit before deleting).

  • Can I change the port speed in the middle of a month?

    Yes, you can increase the port speed at any time without any disruption. You can decrease port speed by deleting the circuit under the existing pricing plan, and re-creating it under the new pricing plan. Please coordinate with your service provider to provision the new circuit.

  • Can I change the pricing plan for a circuit?

    You can change your pricing plan from metered to unlimited at any time without any disruption. You can change the pricing plan from unlimited to metered by deleting the circuit under the unlimited pricing plan, and re-creating it under the metered pricing plan. Please coordinate with your service provider to provision the new circuit.

  • What other charges will I incur when using ExpressRoute dedicated line besides the charges of traffic, port, and physical dedicated lines for cloud connection mentioned above?

    For more details of ExpressRoute dedicated line charges, please refer to VPN Gateway Pricing Details

Support & SLA

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support to select self-service or any other methods to contact us for support.

We guarantee at least 99.9% availability of ExpressRoute private lines. To learn more about the details of our server level agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.
